entries.meaning: An operation in which commercial or military vehicles are respotted.
(manufacturing) The final welding on a manufactured item.

verbs.description: respot (third-person singular simple present respots, present participle respotting, simple past and past participle respotted)

entries.meaning: (sports, billiards, snooker, pool) To replace a ball on its correct spot on a snooker, billiards or pool table.
(sports, bowling) To replace a pin to its correct position prior to a player bowling.
To move a commercial or military vehicle or vehicles into a new position in order to make room for other activity or to allow the moved vehicles to be worked on.
examples: This method insures that the stopping of cars will not gradually fall out of tolerance with a consequent loss of time to respot.

entries.meaning: (manufacturing) To perform the final welds on a manufactured item.
